description.desc1: Que Script is SPARCK own super powerfull scripting language.
description.desc2: You find a nice introduction following the link 'Reference' below.
description.desc3: The implementation of QueScript inside SPARCK follows certain idiosyncracies that are described down below.

edit.descript: edit the loaded file. You can set your prefered editor inside properties.

play que.descript: lists all ques inside the script and allows you to manually execute the chosen one.

show progress bar.descript: shows how each que is progressing

update mode.descript:
there are two modes to choose: 
	<li>automatic will update the script with each frame-pass. 
	<li>custom will allow you to set your own update frequency.

osc node.descript: Que script can create OSC messages, but needs an OscSend node to send them to.

autostart.descript: autostart the script after loading it. It will execute the first <que> inside the script.

Editor.descript: select your prefered editor or add your own.

debug.descript: will output debug information to the console

fileWatch.descript: reloads the script file if it has changed by an external editor. Usually a good idea while you are editing.

Notes.note1: WueScript-commands like <send>, <print>, <osc>, <out>, <trigger> are dealt with in the following way:
Notes.send:
<send> will send the message to the internal dispatcher. It is the only way to control SPARCK parameters. an example would be: 
	<send>/sparck/node ::QueScript::property::autostart 1</send>
Notes.print:
<print> will send the message to the console. an example would be: 
	<print>script passed this point...</print>
Notes.osc:
<osc> will send the message to the linked OscSend node you set in the properties. an example would be: 
	<osc>/my/custom/oscmessage parameter 34</osc>
Notes.out:
<out> will send the message out of the 'out' outled of the node. an example would be: 
	<out>slowly drained creativity</out>
Notes.trigger:
<trigger> will send a trigger message out of the 'trigger' outled of the node. an example would be: 
	<trigger>completely drained creativity</trigger>
